update.description:
A couple of fixed problems:

 * It was hardcoded to use the system version only in Windows. I've change it to honor the user defined variable in other platforms.

 * The headers were using '<ignition/tinyxml2>' what made impossible to use the system version of tinyxml. I've relocated the embedded version to make it compatible with both.
update.title: Fix the build when using the tinyxml2 system

pullrequest.title: Fix the build when using the tinyxml2 system

content.raw: What I meant was that the logic is opposite of the comment. "Using system tinyxml2" would imply `USE_EXTERNAL_TINYXML2` is True, but we have it set to false. Shouldn't the messages and comments say using internal tinyxml2 for all recognized OS's in this logic block, since `USE_EXTERNAL_TINYXML2` is False for each recognized OS?
content.html: What I meant was that the logic is opposite of the comment. "Using system tinyxml2" would imply USE_EXTERNAL_TINYXML2 is True, but we have it set to false. Shouldn't the messages and comments say using internal tinyxml2 for all recognized OS's in this logic block, since USE_EXTERNAL_TINYXML2 is False for each recognized OS?

content.raw: I think that the reason to by default using the tinxyml2 embedded copy was [the result of this conversation with Nate](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2146/internal-tinyxml2/diff#comment-15872625).
content.html: I think that the reason to by default using the tinxyml2 embedded copy was the result of this conversation with Nate.

content.raw:
cppcheck complains about the header include order:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/17/cppcheckResult/

could switch to `#include <tinyxml2.h>` or move down below
content.html:
cppcheck complains about the header include order:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/17/cppcheckResult/

could switch to #include <tinyxml2.h> or move down below
